sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Idiopathic urticaria, chronic: 60 mg ORALLY twice daily OR 180 mg ORALLY once daily with water (manufacturer dosing); if symptoms persist after 2 weeks, may increase up to 4 times the standard dose (guideline dosing)
  • Seasonal allergic rhinitis: 60 mg ORALLY twice daily or 180 mg once daily with water

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono:
• safety and efficacy not established in children less than 6 months of age
  • orally disintegrating tablets (ODT) not approved for children under 6 years of age
  • Idiopathic urticaria, chronic: (6 months to 2 years of age) 15 mg ORALLY twice daily (manufacturer dosing); if symptoms persist after 2 weeks, may increase up to 4 times the standard dose (guideline dosing)
  • Idiopathic urticaria, chronic: (2 to 11 years of age) 30 mg ORALLY twice daily (manufacturer dosing); if symptoms persist after 2 weeks, may increase up to 4 times the standard dose (guideline dosing)
  • Idiopathic urticaria, chronic: (12 years or older) 60 mg ORALLY twice daily OR 180 mg ORALLY once daily with water (manufacturer dosing); if symptoms persist after 2 weeks, may increase up to 4 times the standard dose (guideline dosing)
  • Seasonal allergic rhinitis: 2 to 11 years, 30 mg ORALLY twice daily with water
  • Seasonal allergic rhinitis: 12 years and older, 60 mg ORALLY twice daily or 180 mg once daily with water

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment: adults and children 12 yrs and older, starting dose, 60 mg once daily
  • renal impairment: 2 to 11 yrs, starting dose, 30 mg once daily
  • renal impairment: 6 months to 2 years, starting dose, 15 mg once daily

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Idiopathic urticaria, chronic
  • Seasonal allergic rhinitis
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
  • Hymenoptera immunotherapy, Pretreatment
  • Perennial allergic rhinitis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to fexofenadine or any of the ingredients

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• concurrent administration of aluminum- and magnesium-containing antacid within 15 minutes; decrease fexofenadine absorption
  • concurrent consumption of fruit juices, such as grapefruit, orange, and apple; decrease fexofenadine bioavailability and exposure

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• Fexofenadine: AAP: Maternal medication usually compatible with breastfeeding.
  • Fexofenadine: Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

2.title: Moderate
2.mono:
• Aluminum Carbonate, Basic (probable)
  • Aluminum Hydroxide (probable)
  • Aluminum Phosphate (probable)
  • Dihydroxyaluminum Aminoacetate (probable)
  • Dihydroxyaluminum Sodium Carbonate (probable)
  • Magaldrate (probable)
  • Magnesium Carbonate (probable)
  • Magnesium Hydroxide (probable)
  • Magnesium Oxide (probable)
  • Magnesium Trisilicate (probable)
  • St John's Wort (probable)

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Stomach ache (2.1%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Backache (2.1% to 2.5%)
  • Neurologic:Dizziness (2.1%), Headache (4.8% to 10.3%), Somnolence
  • Other:Fatigue, Pain in limb (2.1%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Fexofenadine hydrochloride inhibits the release of histamine from mast cells and selectively antagonizes peripheral histamine(1)-receptor activity.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono:
• Oral: time to peak concentration, 2.6 h
  • Bioavailability: not yet established

sub.title: Elimination Half Life
sub.mono:
• 14.4 h
  • Mild to moderate renal impairment (creatinine clearance 41 mL/min to 80 mL/min): 59% longer
  • Severe renal impairment (creatinine clearance 11 mL/min to 40 mL/min): 72% longer
  • Patients on dialysis (creatinine clearance less than or equal to 10 mL/min): 31% longer

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • do not take concurrently or closely in time with aluminum and magnesium containing antacids
  • for orally disintegrating tablets only; take on an empty stomach; allow it to disintegrate on the tongue, then swallow with or without water, and do not chew; should not remove from the original blister package until the time of administration
  • (pediatrics) shake suspension well before measuring dose

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• improvement in rhinitis
  • improvement in urticaria
  • CNS effects (eg stimulation)

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Oral Tablet: 30 MG, 60 MG, 180 MG
  • Allegra Allergy
    Oral Tablet: 60 MG, 180 MG
  • Allegra ODT
    Oral Tablet, Disintegrating: 30 MG
  • Allegra
    • Oral Suspension: 30 MG/5 ML
    • Oral Tablet: 60 MG, 180 MG
  • Children's Allegra Allergy
    • Oral Suspension: 30 MG/5 ML
    • Oral Tablet: 30 MG
    • Oral Tablet, Disintegrating: 30 MG
  • Children's Allergy Fexofenadine HCl
    Oral Suspension: 30 MG/5 ML
  • Good Neighbor Pharmacy Allergy Relief
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG
  • Leader Aller-Ease
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG
  • Rite Aid Allergy Relief
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG
  • Sunmark Fexofenadine Hydrochloride
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG
  • TopCare 24-Hour Fexofenadine Hydrochloride
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG
  • WAL-FEX ALLERGY
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG
  • Wal-Fex
    Oral Tablet: 180 MG

sub.title: Clinical Effects
sub.mono:
FEXOFENADINE
OVERDOSE: No human data. Animals: does NOT cause QTc prolongation or dysrhythmias. ADVERSE EFFECTS: nausea, dysmenorrhea, drowsiness & fatigue in <2% of patients.

sub.title: Treatment
sub.mono:
FEXOFENADINE
  • Support: Treatment is symptomatic and supportive.
  • Decontamination: PREHOSPITAL: Prehospital gastrointestinal decontamination is not recommended. HOSPITAL: Administer activated charcoal if the overdose is recent, the patient is not vomiting, and is able to maintain airway.
  • Antidote: None.
  • Monitoring of patient: Obtain baseline ECG, cardiac monitoring with significant overdose. Monitor CNS function.
  • Ventricular arrhythmia: Limited data. Ventricular dysrhythmias have been reported in one patient during therapeutic use. Monitor rhythm following a significant exposure.

sub.title: Range of Toxicity
sub.mono:
FEXOFENADINE
Recommended dose (>12 years) - 60 milligrams, twice daily. No lethal human dose has been reported. Animal data: suggests low toxicity.

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should avoid activities requiring mental alertness or coordination until drug effects are realized.
  • This drug may cause dyspepsia, dizziness, headache, somnolence, dysmenorrhea, or fatigue.
  • Take drug with water. Do not take with fruit juices (grapefruit, orange, apple).
  • Patient should avoid administration of aluminum- or magnesium-containing antacids within 30 min before or after taking drug.
